meanings.definition: The act of introducing a new product or service to the market.
meanings.sent1: The company's successful rollouts of new products boosted their sales.
meanings.sent2: The rollouts of the latest smartphone model generated a lot of excitement among customers.
meanings.sent3: The rollouts of the new ice cream flavors made everyone in the office happy.
meanings.sent4: Her rollouts of creative marketing strategies were like fireworks in the business world.
meanings.sent5: The rollouts of the innovative technology left a lasting impression on the industry.

meanings.definition: The process of extending or unrolling something.
meanings.sent1: The quick rollout of the carpet made the room look brand new.
meanings.sent2: During the renovation, the rollout of the wallpaper was a crucial step.
meanings.sent3: The rollout of the yoga mat signaled the start of the fitness class.
meanings.sent4: The rollout of the red carpet added a touch of elegance to the event.
meanings.sent5: The rollout of the blueprint revealed the intricate design of the building.

meanings.definition: A series of planned events or actions.
meanings.sent1: The rollout of the conference included keynote speeches and workshops.
meanings.sent2: The company's marketing team planned the rollout of the campaign meticulously.
meanings.sent3: The rollout of the surprise birthday party caught him completely off guard.
meanings.sent4: The rollout of the movie franchise attracted a large audience.
meanings.sent5: The rollout of the charity initiative received overwhelming support from the community.
